title: Health & Hygiene - Comprehensive Test
description: Comprehensive test covering human body structure, hygiene, sanitation, diseases, first aid, home nursing, and yoga

questions.text: How many bones are there in the human body?
questions.explanation: The human body has 206 bones of various shapes and sizes that give shape and firmness to the body and protect vital organs.

questions.text: Which type of bones are found in the ankle and wrists?
questions.explanation: Short bones are short and tubular and are found in the ankle and wrists, while long bones are in limbs, flat bones in cranium, and irregular bones in vertebral column.

questions.text: What is the normal pulse rate for an average adult?
questions.explanation: The average pulse rate is 72 beats per minute. For infants it is 100-140 bpm and for children 90-100 bpm.

questions.text: What is the normal body temperature when measured by mouth?
questions.explanation: Normal temperature by mouth is 98.4°F or 37°C. By axilla or groin it is 1°F lower, and by rectum it is 1°F higher.

questions.text: Which of these is a voluntary muscle?
questions.explanation: Voluntary or skeletal muscles are attached to bones and controlled by will, forming about 47% of body weight. Cardiac and smooth muscles are involuntary.

questions.text: What is the process of heating milk to destroy pathogens without destroying nutritive value called?
questions.explanation: Pasteurization involves heating milk to 130°C for 1-2 seconds to destroy pathogens without altering taste or nutritive value.

questions.text: Which method of water purification uses potassium permanganate?
questions.explanation: Pinking is done using potassium permanganate during cholera epidemics to disinfect wells and water sources.

questions.text: What is the most satisfactory method of refuse disposal where suitable land is available?
questions.explanation: Controlled tipping or sanitary landfill is the most satisfactory method of refuse disposal where suitable land is available.

questions.text: Which type of latrine has a water seal that prevents access to flies and escape of foul odour?
questions.explanation: Water Seal Latrine performs two important functions: prevents access to flies and prevents escape of foul odour. The RCA type is widely adopted.

questions.text: According to WHO, how is health defined?

options.c: Complete state of physical, mental and social well-being
options.d: Normal functioning of all body systems

questions.explanation: WHO defines health as 'a complete state of physical, mental and social well-being' and not merely the absence of disease or infirmity.

questions.text: Which of these is NOT a characteristic of a healthy mind?
questions.explanation: Undue anxiety is an indicator of mental disorders. Characteristics of a healthy mind include cheerful outlook, good temper, normal appetite, and socially acceptable habits.

questions.text: Which disease is transmitted through droplet infection?
questions.explanation: Tuberculosis is spread through droplet infection when germs are sprayed out from nose, throat or lungs during coughing, sneezing or talking.

questions.text: Which insect is the carrier of Malaria?
questions.explanation: Mosquitoes carry Malaria, Dengue and Filaria. Sand flies carry Kala Zar, fleas carry plague, and lice carry typhus.

questions.text: What is the first aid treatment for snake bite?

options.b: Give plenty of water to drink

questions.explanation: For snake bite, apply a light constricting tourniquet above the bite, wash with soap and water, incise the skin, suck the blood, and evacuate to hospital.

questions.text: Which artificial respiration method is used when the casualty is in prone position?
questions.explanation: Holger-Nielson Method is used when casualty is in prone position, while Schaefer's method also uses prone position but with different technique.

questions.text: What does the acronym NURSE stand for in home nursing?
questions.explanation: NURSE stands for Nobility/Knowledge, Usefulness/Understanding, Righteousness/Responsibility, Simplicity/Sympathy, Efficiency/Equanimity.

questions.text: Which bandaging method is used for parts of uniform thickness like fingers or wrists?
questions.explanation: Simple Spiral is used when the part is of uniform thickness. Reverse Spiral is for varying thickness, and Figure of 8 is for joints.

questions.text: What is the ideal direction for a sick room to face?
questions.explanation: The sick room should face South or South-West and should be away from noise with bathroom and lavatory close by.

questions.text: Which type of fracture has broken bones protruding through the skin?
questions.explanation: Compound or Open fracture has skin broken and sometimes broken bones protruding. Simple fracture has skin intact, complicated fracture damages underlying structures.

questions.text: What is the first aid for dislocation?

options.c: Do not try to reduce it

questions.explanation: For dislocation, do not try to reduce it. Immobilize the joint with sling or bandage, apply cold compress, and send to hospital.

questions.text: Which asana is known for awakening the power of Kundalini?
questions.explanation: Siddhasana's main function is to awaken the power of Kundalini. It helps the mind to be firm, attentive and alert.

questions.text: How many positions are there in Surya Namaskar?
questions.explanation: Surya Namaskar is a combined sequence of 12 positions that exercises the whole body comprehensively.

questions.text: Which asana can be done immediately after eating food?
questions.explanation: Vajrasana can be done immediately after eating food as it helps digestion and eliminates gas troubles.

questions.text: What is the recommended age for children to start yoga exercises?
questions.explanation: Yoga exercises are not recommended for children under 16 because their nervous and glandular systems are still growing.

questions.text: Which of these is a potential benefit of yoga for heart patients?
questions.explanation: Yoga may reduce high blood pressure, improve symptoms of heart failure, enhance cardiac rehabilitation, and lower cardiovascular risk factors.

questions.text: What is the average amount of sleep required per day for an adult?
questions.explanation: The average requirement of sleep is about 7 to 8 hours a day, though this varies with individual age.

questions.text: Which system is responsible for filtering waste from blood in the human body?
questions.explanation: The urinary system, particularly the kidneys, acts as filters to remove waste from blood and maintain fluid balance.

questions.text: What is the process of removing suspended matter from water by passing it through gravel and sand called?
questions.explanation: Clarification is the removal of suspended matter through filtration by passing water through filter beds of gravel and sand.

questions.text: Which type of waste disposal method is best for hospital refuse?
questions.explanation: Incineration is best for hospital refuse which is particularly dangerous, as it completely destroys pathogens.

questions.text: What is the main cause of asphyxia in drowning cases?
questions.explanation: In drowning, asphyxia occurs due to water entering the air passage and preventing normal respiration.

questions.text: Which bandage is made of elastic material and used for sprains and strains?
questions.explanation: Crepe bandage is made of elastic material which stretches and binds firmly around joints, helping reduce swelling and movement.

questions.text: What is the temperature range of a clinical thermometer?
questions.explanation: The range of clinical thermometer is 95°F to 110°F with degrees indicated by black lines and normal temperature marked at 98.4°F.

questions.text: Which asana is recommended for Jaap, Dhyana and Samadhi?
questions.explanation: Padmasana is useful for Jaap (chanting), Dhyana (meditation) and Samadhi (deep meditation), and also helps in curing asthma, hysteria and insomnia.

questions.text: What is the first aid treatment for burns?

options.c: Protect burnt area with clean dressing

questions.explanation: For burns, protect the burnt area with bandage or clean cloth, give complete rest and fluids, reassure patient, and evacuate to hospital.

questions.text: Which system controls involuntary functions like stomach and intestine movements?
questions.explanation: Autonomic Nervous System controls involuntary functions of internal organs like stomach, intestine, bladder, and secretions of liver and kidneys.

questions.text: What is the purpose of Gyan Mudra in yoga?
questions.explanation: Gyan Mudra is most suitable for pranayam (breathing exercises) and dhyana (meditation).

questions.text: Which method of sewage treatment involves using anaerobic and aerobic bacteria?
questions.explanation: Activated Sludge Process uses anaerobic and aerobic bacteria to treat sewage through biological action.

questions.text: What is the recommended time for holding Sarvangasana?
questions.explanation: Sarvangasana should be held for ½ to 1 minute initially. It improves circulatory, respiratory and alimentary systems.

questions.text: Which quality is NOT essential for a good nurse?
questions.explanation: A good nurse should be patient, sympathetic, cheerful, gentle, observant, tactful, courageous and have team spirit - not impatient or harsh.

questions.text: What is the first aid for foreign body in ear?

options.a: Use pin or forceps to remove
options.b: Pour oil to float it out
options.c: Do not try to remove it
options.d: Use water to flush it out

questions.explanation: For foreign body in ear, do not try to remove with pin or forceps as this may push it further and damage eardrum. Send patient to hospital.

questions.text: Which asana is known as the 'Bow pose'?
questions.explanation: Dhanurasana is known as the Bow pose as the body resembles a bow when performed. It exercises abdominal muscles, lower back and thighs.

questions.text: What is the main purpose of sterilization using autoclaving?
questions.explanation: Autoclaving or steam under pressure is the most effective method to destroy all germs and sterilize hospital equipment.

questions.text: Which type of fracture is caused by diseases of bones?
questions.explanation: Certain diseases of bones make them weak and easily breakable, causing fractures even with minimal force.

questions.text: What is the recommended sleeping position for a patient with fracture of spine?
questions.explanation: For fracture of spine, carry the patient face downwards on a board placed lengthwise on the stretcher to prevent further spinal injury.

questions.text: Which asana is known for providing complete relaxation in shortest time?
questions.explanation: Shavasana provides complete relaxation in the shortest possible time and helps in releasing the mind from the body.

questions.text: What is the purpose of applying splints in fracture treatment?
questions.explanation: Splints are applied to immobilize the fracture and prevent movement of broken bones, which reduces pain and prevents further injury.

questions.text: Which method of artificial respiration involves blowing directly into patient's mouth?
questions.explanation: Mouth to Mouth respiration involves blowing directly into patient's mouth through clean gauze at 10-12 times per minute.

questions.text: What is the main symptom of a strain?
questions.explanation: Strain shows sudden sharp pain, possible swelling or severe cramp, and difficulty in further exertion.

questions.text: Which asana stimulates blood circulation and makes spine flexible?
questions.explanation: Halasana stimulates blood circulation and makes the spine flexible and elastic. It should be held for 30-50 seconds.

questions.text: What is the primary goal of home nursing?

options.b: Reduce frequency and intensity of sickness

questions.explanation: Home nursing aims to reduce the intensity and frequency of sickness to the barest minimum through proper care at home.
